item.title: Digi.City
item.description: Digi.City is a platform designed to inform and inspire leaders as cities advance in the digital age. We convene the public, private and academic sectors, share tools and advocate for policies and programs that create more connected communities. Smart Cities
item.author: (Smart City Startups Help Cities Communicate about COVID-19)

item.title: HttpClient - Error handling, a test driven approach
item.description: Shows how to handle a bunch of different tricky scenarios when dealing with HttpClient. Error handling, deserialization, timeouts...I've got you covered.

item.title: Impossible Squares - Numberphile
item.description:
Ben Sparks shows us a simple problem that takes some fascinating twists. Check out Brilliant (get 20% off their premium service): https://brilliant.org/numberphile (sponsor)
More links & stuff in full description below ↓↓↓
More videos with Ben Sparks: http://bit.ly/Sparks_Playlist
Ben's website: https://www.bensparks.co.uk
Numberphile is supported by the Mathematical Sciences Research Institute (MSRI): http://bit.ly/MSRINumberphile
We are also supported by Science Sandbox, a Simons Foundation initiative dedicated to engaging everyone with the process of science. https://www.simonsfoundation.org/outreach/science-sandbox/
And support from Math For America - https://www.mathforamerica.org/
NUMBERPHILE Website: http://www.numberphile.com/ Numberphile on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/numberphile Numberphile tweets: https://twitter.com/numberphile Subscribe: http://bit.ly/Numberphile_Sub
Videos by Brady Haran
Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/numberphile
Numberphile T-Shirts and Merch: https://teespring.com/stores/numberphile
Brady's videos subreddit: http://www.reddit.com/r/BradyHaran/
Brady's latest videos across all channels: http://www.bradyharanblog.com/
Sign up for (occasional) emails: http://eepurl.com/YdjL9

item.title: Reassuring Words and Good Intentions Don't Mean Good Security
item.description: How much can you trust the assertions made by an organisation regarding their security posture? I don't mean to question whether the statements are truthful or not, but rather whether they provide any actual assurance whatsoever.

item.title: Move Fast & Roll Your Own Crypto: A Quick Look at the Confidentiality of Zoom Meetings - The Citizen Lab
item.description: This report examines the encryption that protects meetings in Zoom and finds that they have made their own encryption scheme and has significant weaknesses.
item.author: (Bill Marczak)
